response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ["Age and Gender", "high", "Being a 19‐year-old male is associated with a higher risk of recidivism because young males statistically show higher rates of reoffending."],
    ["Criminal History", "medium", "Having 1 prior arrest and conviction indicates past behavior that could recur, though the low frequency tempers the risk somewhat."],
    ["Education", "high", "Lacking a high school diploma or GED is a significant risk factor, as lower educational attainment correlates with higher recidivism."],
    ["Employment Stability", "medium", "Holding 3 jobs over the past year may indicate instability in employment, contributing moderately to recidivism risk."],
    ["Substance Use", "medium", "Past marijuana use, while less severe than other drugs, still contributes as a risk factor given its association with behavioral issues."],
    ["Mental Health", "medium", "Experiencing periods of feeling down suggests potential mental health concerns that may affect decision-making."],
    ["Family and Environmental Background", "medium", "Growing up in an urban household of moderate size may reflect exposure to environmental stressors associated with higher recidivism."]
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 70
}

risk_factors: Being a 19‐year-old male is associated with a higher risk of recidivism because young males statistically show higher rates of reoffending.
Having 1 prior arrest and conviction indicates past behavior that could recur, though the low frequency tempers the risk somewhat.
Lacking a high school diploma or GED is a significant risk factor, as lower educational attainment correlates with higher recidivism.
Holding 3 jobs over the past year may indicate instability in employment, contributing moderately to recidivism risk.
Past marijuana use, while less severe than other drugs, still contributes as a risk factor given its association with behavioral issues.
Experiencing periods of feeling down suggests potential mental health concerns that may affect decision-making.
Growing up in an urban household of moderate size may reflect exposure to environmental stressors associated with higher recidivism.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 19-year-old male who identifies himself as Hispanic. He has been arrested 1 time and has been convicted. He is 5 feet 11 inches and weighs 155 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He does not have a high school diploma or GED certificate and is not enrolled in college. He has held 3 jobs during the year. He has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana) and some of the time during the past month he has felt so down in the dumps that nothing could cheer him up. At a young age, he lived with his biological mother in a household of size 4, in an urban area. He considers that God has something to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
